summary:
I never understood why people take Arya’s “That’s not me” so literal. 
What i understand, the meaning of hers “that’s not me”,...
body:
I never understood why people take Arya’s “That’s not me” so literal. 

What i understand, the meaning of hers “that’s not me”, is a child, at that time, who thought being a lady meant like it was in her sister’s dreams at that time: be a trophy wife, someone who wouldn’t be involved in truly ruling and handling things, someone submissive to her Lord Husband, only a decorative piece who should give some kids and act how they deemed proper to a woman at said time/place”.

I really don’t think adult Arya would have a problem with becoming the wife of someone who is equal to her; someone who respects her and walks besides her, who followed her; someone who loves her exactly the way she is; someone who is fascinated by how independent, brave and strong she is even if , of course, he fears for her safety; someone who listens to her and is willing to help and be helped by her; someone who loves her and would never want her to be just at home if they have to face battles, but fighting along side him, knowing how skilled she is, how great of a warrior she is; someone happy to be able to talk to her, listen and have her company on peace days, a family to love and be loved. Someone like Gendry. 

I always say that people are fine with the idea of male Lord, knights and warriors having a loving family while being badasses at war, at ruling etc, but don’t think women can do that. It’s insane.

Arya has now a lot more respect to the ladies than she had too, her own prejudice to what a lady is/ was supposed to be. She now can see how important they are and the difference they make in their own particular ways.

And the thing that catches my attention even more: the subversion of expectations. The irony of it all. Havign the sister who never want to marry, be a lady and have kids having them, being one but on her owm terms. Redefining what is means to be a lady at that time. 

Sounds like damn great idea to me if that’s what she wants in the end.

body:
Me at some people…

“I love Arya. It would be awesome if she was a Kings/Queens Guard to *insert their favs* for the rest of her life”


“I love Arya but she’s no one, she can’t have emotional connection anymore, she’s just a cold and badass assassin”


“I love Arya, she shouldn’t have any romance because she’s a strong independent woman who needs no man and that’s feminism”

“I love Arya, she should just finish her list and live her days alone being a badass alone or maybe create a group of high profile assassins”

“I love Arya, but i don’t think she should make love to the guy she loves.” “Anyway, she doesn’t even love him, see her face after she fucked Gendry? lolz She just wanted dick, she just wanted to fuck anyone and she didn’t even like after. Bad Sex, weak dick game. lolz Much Funny”

You don’t fool anyone, darlings, you don’t care about her, you don’t bother to understand Arya at all.

blog.name: jaqaryafics
blog.title: I'm big Jaqarya trash
blog.description: There are not enough Arya x Jaqen fics, I'm taking matters into my own amateur hands. Canon = Wack, Fics = Tight as FUCK, send in requests please!

summary: Arya Stark x Jaqen H'ghar One Shot
body:
Arya Stark x Jaqen H'ghar One Shot

Summary: When Arya leaves Braavos to go home, she meets an old friend who isn’t who she thought he was.

Notes: This is kind of an AU I guess? Canon? Never heard of that, not important, fics are here to fix it… It’s kinda angsty but also fluffy at the end. This is my first fanfic so please let me know what you think if you read it c:

When Arya first set foot on Westerosi soil after a long time, it felt different. She expected to feel at home.

Stupid girl. She thought, You’re still a long way from home. The image of Winterfell appeared in her mind. The snow, the castle, the godswood and the weirwood tree. Gods know how it all looks like now. When thinking about the place that was once her home, Arya felt strange. It didn’t quite feel like home anymore. Too much time spent so far from it and so many important memories that she made, none of them were connected to Winterfell.

She felt a stinging feeling in her heart. Betrayal? Heartbreak? Probably both. When she sailed to Braavos to find the man she trusted the most, all she got in return was pain and scars. Oh, so many scars. How could Jaqen H'ghar do this to her? All this time, she thought he… no, of course he didn’t.

You’re a fool for even thinking it. She scolded herself in her mind and felt her heart sink a little again. She must move on. Jaqen H'ghar is dead, he said it himself. With this thought, the memory of him drinking poison, and then his dead body on the floor of the Hall of Faces played on repeat in her head. Arya couldn’t help it, her eyes started watering. At the point when her eyes were covered in a layer of salty tears and her vision blurred by them, she looked down and closed her eyes. The tears dropped on the green Westerosi grass.

She didn’t even know how she got this far. Lost in her thoughts, she walked inlands, the port barely visible from behind a small hill she passed. The sun already started to set, coming closer to the horizon and painting the sky a peachy hue. She shook her head to clear her thoughts and walked towards a town she saw in the distance. She had enough silver to get herself a room for the night at an inn.

_______________________

After a bit of bargaining, the innkeeper growled and gave her a key to one of the small rooms in the attic.

It wasn’t much, but the bed was softer and larger compared to what she slept on in Braavos. It even had fox fur covers. She closed the door behind her and sat on the edge of the bed, looking out of the small window, watching the sky change colours as the sun went down. Suddenly she had a strange feeling in her gut. She grabbed Needle and quickly stood up and turned around to see a familiar figure towering over the bedframe. Of course she couldn’t hear him coming, he was quiet as always with that half smirk on his face that never goes away.

“A girl looks sad.” Jaqen smiled gently at her. He was no longer wearing the cloak like in the House of Black and White. He was dressed in dark armour, with a longsword resting by his side. It was nowhere as noble as the Lannister armour he wore in Harrenhal. It was more like what her brother Jon wore, when she last saw him.

“Did you come to kill me?” Arya hissed at him. She tried not to show any emotions.

“A man would never do such a thing. However I’ve heard the faceless men weren’t so gentle with a lovely girl.” He spoke so calmly, his eyes looked like they were smiling. Arya even saw relief and sadness in them, she didn’t know what to think about it.

“It was you! You beat me, blinded me, did your stupid suicide trick to make me think you’re dead. I’m not falling for any of your tricks anymore!” She gradually raised her voice and failed to keep a stone cold face. She caught herself pointing Needle at Jaqen’s chest as she looked up into his eyes.

Jaqen couldn’t bear when to see her like this. A lovely girl, who trusted him, and he wasn’t there when she needed him the most. It broke his heart to see her all broken, thinking he’s betrayed her. There was a connection between them, a strong bond. Even when she was pointing a sword at him, knowing full well she’s capable of impaling his heart at this very moment, he still hoped there’s some of it left.

“Arya.” He looked her in the eyes. It was a gift to him that she’s still alive and he could see her eyes quickly travelling to look at his hands, then lips, he even caught her stealing a glimpse at the silver streak in his hair.

“A man only came to Braavos when a girl was already gone. This face can be worn by others. And you gave them the name on a plate.” He stood there still, like a statue.

Arya didn’t say a word.

“You told them you were looking for Jaqen H'ghar. Of course they knew how to make a girl trust them.” He gave out a small sigh and looked down.

“A man is sorry. He should never have left a girl. Will a lovely girl forgive a man?” He looked her in the eyes again.

Lovely girl. Those words echoed through Arya’s head like beautiful music. Her heart beat two times faster, she never realized how much she needs to hear those words. Until now. She craved them.

“Lovely girl, please.” Jaqen said, as if he was reading her mind, “A girl may have owed a debt to the Red God. It has been paid. But a man also owes a girl. For saving his life.”

As she looked into his eyes, she slowly lowered Needle. She saw nothing but coldness in the eyes of the man she believed to be Jaqen in Braavos. These eyes were different. The way he looked at her, soft, warm, like he’s trying to envelop her with protective beams of light. She dropped Needle on the floor and let in a deep breath.

Jaqen smiled and took a step towards her. Ever since they parted there wasn’t a day he didn’t think about her. Where is Arya Stark now? Is she okay? When will we meet again? He wanted to wrap his arms around her small body, kiss her on her chestnut hair and never let go. Even though he wasn’t the one who beat and hurt her, the guilt was still unbearable. What does she see, what does she think and feel when she looks at his face now? His lovely girl, she despised him. And that was breaking his heart.

“A man must ask for forgiveness. He failed a girl. Now she’s grown stronger, she can take care of herself. Please, forgive a man and he’ll be on his way. A girl will never have to look at a man again, I promise.”

“A girl forgives.” Arya said quietly. She didn’t blindly trust him like before. Her trust in him was broken, but that was the trust in another man wearing his face. This man standing in front of her was her Jaqen, she knew that. How could she be so stupid to trust those faceless men. Of course she felt like something was off back then, especially with “Jaqen”. But she just accepted the thought that he didn’t care about her. She couldn’t be more wrong.

Jaqen nodded. “Very well.” He leaned closer to her, so close she could smell his scent of ginger and cloves. He stared deeply into her eyes and got lost in them for a moment. Just one more second and he would…

“A man should say goodbye now.” He abruptly looked away and straightened his posture again.

Arya let out a soft gasp and desperately looked at him with her big eyes.

Jaqen turned around and opened the door, ready to leave.

“Take care, lovely girl.” He smiled to hide the pain. As he took a step out of the room into the hallway, he felt a hand grabbing his arm and pulling it back.

“Please don’t go Jaqen.” Arya made him turn around and looked at him like she did when they left Harrenhal.

Jaqen didn’t need any more convincing. He stepped back into the room and closed the door. There was no point resisting it now, he wrapped his arms around her and held her tightly. Arya did the same and pressed her whole body against him. Jaqen wanted to say something when she pushed away, but didn’t get the chance. She stood up on her tiptoes and pressed her lips against his. He put his arms around her waist and pulled her closer.

“A girl should sleep.” Jaqen smirked as he looked down at Arya’s smiling face.

“Will you stay with me?”

“A man will do whatever a lovely girl wishes.” He laid down on the bed. “Come here. Get some rest.”

Arya did as he said and crawled under the covers. She felt warm and safe as Jaqen held her and planted soft kisses on her head every other moment. She laid her head down on his chest and listened to his heartbeat. After some time, she felt like her heart was in sync with his.

It didn’t take her long to fall asleep. For the first time in years, Arya Stark didn’t go to sleep worrying about tomorrow. Because for her there was only right now. And right now, she felt safe.

What does she see, what does she think and feel when she looks at his face now? His lovely girl, she despised him. And that was breaking his heart.

“A man must ask for forgiveness. He failed a girl. Now she’s grown stronger, she can take care of herself. Please, forgive a man and he’ll be on his way. A girl will never have to look at a man again, I promise.”

“A girl forgives.” Arya said quietly. She didn’t blindly trust him like before. Her trust in him was broken, but that was the trust in another man wearing his face. This man standing in front of her was her Jaqen, she knew that. How could she be so stupid to trust those faceless men. Of course she felt like something was off back then, especially with “Jaqen”. But she just accepted the thought that he didn’t care about her. She couldn’t be more wrong.

Jaqen nodded. “Very well.” He leaned closer to her, so close she could smell his scent of ginger and cloves. He stared deeply into her eyes and got lost in them for a moment. Just one more second and he would…

“A man should say goodbye now.” He abruptly looked away and straightened his posture again.

Arya let out a soft gasp and desperately looked at him with her big eyes.

Jaqen turned around and opened the door, ready to leave.

“Take care, lovely girl.” He smiled to hide the pain. As he took a step out of the room into the hallway, he felt a hand grabbing his arm and pulling it back.

“Please don’t go Jaqen.” Arya made him turn around and looked at him like she did when they left Harrenhal.

Jaqen didn’t need any more convincing. He stepped back into the room and closed the door. There was no point resisting it now, he wrapped his arms around her and held her tightly. Arya did the same and pressed her whole body against him. Jaqen wanted to say something when she pushed away, but didn’t get the chance. She stood up on her tiptoes and pressed her lips against his. He put his arms around her waist and pulled her closer.

“A girl should sleep.” Jaqen smirked as he looked down at Arya’s smiling face.

“Will you stay with me?”

“A man will do whatever a lovely girl wishes.” He laid down on the bed. “Come here. Get some rest.”

Arya did as he said and crawled under the covers. She felt warm and safe as Jaqen held her and planted soft kisses on her head every other moment. She laid her head down on his chest and listened to his heartbeat. After some time, she felt like her heart was in sync with his.

It didn’t take her long to fall asleep. For the first time in years, Arya Stark didn’t go to sleep worrying about tomorrow. Because for her there was only right now. And right now, she felt safe.

Arya Stark x Jaqen H'ghar One Shot

Summary: When Arya leaves Braavos to go home, she meets an old friend who isn’t who she thought he was.

Notes: This is kind of an AU I guess? Canon? Never heard of that, not important, fics are here to fix it… It’s kinda angsty but also fluffy at the end. This is my first fanfic so please let me know what you think if you read it c:

When Arya first set foot on Westerosi soil after a long time, it felt different. She expected to feel at home.

Stupid girl. She thought, You’re still a long way from home. The image of Winterfell appeared in her mind. The snow, the castle, the godswood and the weirwood tree. Gods know how it all looks like now. When thinking about the place that was once her home, Arya felt strange. It didn’t quite feel like home anymore. Too much time spent so far from it and so many important memories that she made, none of them were connected to Winterfell.

She felt a stinging feeling in her heart. Betrayal? Heartbreak? Probably both. When she sailed to Braavos to find the man she trusted the most, all she got in return was pain and scars. Oh, so many scars. How could Jaqen H'ghar do this to her? All this time, she thought he… no, of course he didn’t.

You’re a fool for even thinking it. She scolded herself in her mind and felt her heart sink a little again. She must move on. Jaqen H'ghar is dead, he said it himself. With this thought, the memory of him drinking poison, and then his dead body on the floor of the Hall of Faces played on repeat in her head. Arya couldn’t help it, her eyes started watering. At the point when her eyes were covered in a layer of salty tears and her vision blurred by them, she looked down and closed her eyes. The tears dropped on the green Westerosi grass.

She didn’t even know how she got this far. Lost in her thoughts, she walked inlands, the port barely visible from behind a small hill she passed. The sun already started to set, coming closer to the horizon and painting the sky a peachy hue. She shook her head to clear her thoughts and walked towards a town she saw in the distance. She had enough silver to get herself a room for the night at an inn.

_______________________

After a bit of bargaining, the innkeeper growled and gave her a key to one of the small rooms in the attic.

It wasn’t much, but the bed was softer and larger compared to what she slept on in Braavos. It even had fox fur covers. She closed the door behind her and sat on the edge of the bed, looking out of the small window, watching the sky change colours as the sun went down. Suddenly she had a strange feeling in her gut. She grabbed Needle and quickly stood up and turned around to see a familiar figure towering over the bedframe. Of course she couldn’t hear him coming, he was quiet as always with that half smirk on his face that never goes away.

“A girl looks sad.” Jaqen smiled gently at her. He was no longer wearing the cloak like in the House of Black and White. He was dressed in dark armour, with a longsword resting by his side. It was nowhere as noble as the Lannister armour he wore in Harrenhal. It was more like what her brother Jon wore, when she last saw him.

“Did you come to kill me?” Arya hissed at him. She tried not to show any emotions.

“A man would never do such a thing. However I’ve heard the faceless men weren’t so gentle with a lovely girl.” He spoke so calmly, his eyes looked like they were smiling. Arya even saw relief and sadness in them, she didn’t know what to think about it.

“It was you! You beat me, blinded me, did your stupid suicide trick to make me think you’re dead. I’m not falling for any of your tricks anymore!” She gradually raised her voice and failed to keep a stone cold face. She caught herself pointing Needle at Jaqen’s chest as she looked up into his eyes.

Jaqen couldn’t bear when to see her like this. A lovely girl, who trusted him, and he wasn’t there when she needed him the most. It broke his heart to see her all broken, thinking he’s betrayed her. There was a connection between them, a strong bond. Even when she was pointing a sword at him, knowing full well she’s capable of impaling his heart at this very moment, he still hoped there’s some of it left.

“Arya.” He looked her in the eyes. It was a gift to him that she’s still alive and he could see her eyes quickly travelling to look at his hands, then lips, he even caught her stealing a glimpse at the silver streak in his hair.

“A man only came to Braavos when a girl was already gone. This face can be worn by others. And you gave them the name on a plate.” He stood there still, like a statue.

Arya didn’t say a word.

“You told them you were looking for Jaqen H'ghar. Of course they knew how to make a girl trust them.” He gave out a small sigh and looked down.

“A man is sorry. He should never have left a girl. Will a lovely girl forgive a man?” He looked her in the eyes again.

Lovely girl. Those words echoed through Arya’s head like beautiful music. Her heart beat two times faster, she never realized how much she needs to hear those words. Until now. She craved them.

“Lovely girl, please.” Jaqen said, as if he was reading her mind, “A girl may have owed a debt to the Red God. It has been paid. But a man also owes a girl. For saving his life.”

As she looked into his eyes, she slowly lowered Needle. She saw nothing but coldness in the eyes of the man she believed to be Jaqen in Braavos. These eyes were different. The way he looked at her, soft, warm, like he’s trying to envelop her with protective beams of light. She dropped Needle on the floor and let in a deep breath.

Jaqen smiled and took a step towards her. Ever since they parted there wasn’t a day he didn’t think about her. Where is Arya Stark now? Is she okay? When will we meet again? He wanted to wrap his arms around her small body, kiss her on her chestnut hair and never let go. Even though he wasn’t the one who beat and hurt her, the guilt was still unbearable. What does she see, what does she think and feel when she looks at his face now? His lovely girl, she despised him. And that was breaking his heart.

“A man must ask for forgiveness. He failed a girl. Now she’s grown stronger, she can take care of herself. Please, forgive a man and he’ll be on his way. A girl will never have to look at a man again, I promise.”

“A girl forgives.” Arya said quietly. She didn’t blindly trust him like before. Her trust in him was broken, but that was the trust in another man wearing his face. This man standing in front of her was her Jaqen, she knew that. How could she be so stupid to trust those faceless men. Of course she felt like something was off back then, especially with “Jaqen”. But she just accepted the thought that he didn’t care about her. She couldn’t be more wrong.

Jaqen nodded. “Very well.” He leaned closer to her, so close she could smell his scent of ginger and cloves. He stared deeply into her eyes and got lost in them for a moment. Just one more second and he would…

“A man should say goodbye now.” He abruptly looked away and straightened his posture again.

Arya let out a soft gasp and desperately looked at him with her big eyes.

Jaqen turned around and opened the door, ready to leave.

“Take care, lovely girl.” He smiled to hide the pain. As he took a step out of the room into the hallway, he felt a hand grabbing his arm and pulling it back.

“Please don’t go Jaqen.” Arya made him turn around and looked at him like she did when they left Harrenhal.

Jaqen didn’t need any more convincing. He stepped back into the room and closed the door. There was no point resisting it now, he wrapped his arms around her and held her tightly. Arya did the same and pressed her whole body against him. Jaqen wanted to say something when she pushed away, but didn’t get the chance. She stood up on her tiptoes and pressed her lips against his. He put his arms around her waist and pulled her closer.

“A girl should sleep.” Jaqen smirked as he looked down at Arya’s smiling face.

“Will you stay with me?”

“A man will do whatever a lovely girl wishes.” He laid down on the bed. “Come here. Get some rest.”

Arya did as he said and crawled under the covers. She felt warm and safe as Jaqen held her and planted soft kisses on her head every other moment. She laid her head down on his chest and listened to his heartbeat. After some time, she felt like her heart was in sync with his.

It didn’t take her long to fall asleep. For the first time in years, Arya Stark didn’t go to sleep worrying about tomorrow. Because for her there was only right now. And right now, she felt safe.

blog.name: waking-dreams-of-harmony
blog.title: Headcanon is the new reality...
blog.description:
Hi there! My name is Ellie! Welcome to my tumblr!  Just thought I'd add a few things to know about me and my blog! If my url gives you any clues, at the heart of this tumblr, I'm a proud Harmony shipper through and through. And while I do still reblog HHR and Dan and Emma content (and I always will) you will find that the majority of my focus has shifted to Jonerys (Jon x Daenerys from Game of Thrones). And while you might have to do a little deep blogging to find my reblogs on these, I also ship--both passionately and casually--Cesare x Lucrezia, Mulder x Scully, Lizzington for a while until tptb started to mess with it, Baker x Lawson (Bawson), all the Sense8 ships though Kalagang is my #1, Clint x Natasha (Clintasha), Jane x Thor (Fosterson), Darcy x Loki (Tasertricks), Darcy x Steve (Shieldshock), Kili x Tauriel (Kiliel), Superman x Wonder Woman (Superwonder), and more than I have space for or the memory to list. 
I do my best to tag every post so that if something is your notp, it's nsfw, or it's triggering, you can blacklist it. That said, if you follow me and there is something that you need tagged in order to make it a happy place for you to explore, come into my inbox and let me know :) You will also see a lot of politically charged reblogs in support of women, the queer/gender-queer and trans community, BLM, Muslims, POC, Jewish people, the mentally ill, and austistic people. I'm strongly pro choice, pro inter-sectional feminism, and refuse to call the angry cheeto currently living in the white house president. If anything like that offends you, this might not be the right blog for you.
Last little few things to throw out there: I'm 35, I plan to adopt at least 4 cats (or more) at some point and be that cat lady everyone's always whispering about, and I tend to greet and converse with everyone I meet like an overeager puppy. 
Whew! Sorry for the long intro folks! Please enjoy your time here, and remember, you're always welcome to come in and say hi!

body:
The Death of Queen Cersei

Okay so the two of the major theories out there for the final season are that either

Jamie Lannister will kill his sister and will die in the process (though I hope not, I would be very happy to see Jamie and Brienne together.)

Or

Jamie will die and Arya will take his face and kill Cersei, still fulfilling the whole being killed by her little brother.

There are other obvious choices to kill Cersei such as Sansa, Bronn, Tyrion, Daenerys etc.

But what if there was one other person who could end the life of Cersei Lannister

I present Gendry, Illegitimate son of Robert of the House Baratheon, possibly the last of the Baratheon children ( I miss Shireen 😭)

Though it is unlikely that Gendry would kill someone out of cold blood, he had a good case for it

- Cersei had her cousin spike his father’s drink which led to him not being fit enough to survive the Boar that killed his father

- She and Joffrey sent out the order for all his unknown half-siblings to be killed including little baby Barra.

- Though he only met Ned Stark the once, after meeting Arya he grew to understand what a great and accepting father, Ned was.

- Along with Arya and the rest of the Night Watch Recruits he saw Yoren cut down by Lannister men because they were looking for him on Cersei’s(?) orders

- At Harrenhal, he was almost tortured to death by more Lannister men, only be saved and put to work to her father Tywin Lannister

This theory is all circumstantial and it is unlikely that it will be him but it is an interesting possibility especially now that he is reunited with Arya as well as the fact that he may quite possibly accept the title of Lord Gendry Baratheon, Lord of Storm’s End, first of his name etc

title: Who are you Texting?
body:
Canon is being perfect, so Imma write some AU fics to get me through the week. 

Gendrya Modern!Au Whoop whoop!

“Do you think we should ask Gendry to invite his girlfriend?” asked Hot Pie as sorted through his extensive bad-movie collection. 

Arya felt her heart stop for a moment, but ignored it. “What are you talking about?” 

“That girl he’s always texting,” responded Hot Pie casually. Finally, he looked up and noticed his friend’s unreadable expression. “Don’t tell me you haven’t noticed? The dude is addicted to his phone!”

“Gendry?” questioned Arya. Gendry wasn’t addicted to his phone. Arya spent months  trying to convince him to trade in his Nokia for a smartphone, and even then it was only after his new job required him to. She spent three hours last week teaching him how to download Snapchat before the guy completely gave up and nearly destroyed it. 

Hot Pie laughed. “Arry, you seriously haven’t noticed?”

“How do you know he’s texting a girl though?”

“He always gets smiley and shit, plus yesterday I asked him about it and his face got sooo red!” Hot Pie went back to shuffle through a few discs. “Do you think she could set me up with one of her friends when he finally introduces us?”

“Introduces who?” Gendry walked into his and Hot Pie’s shared apartment with an extra-large pizza in his arms. 

“Your girlf-” Arya kicked Hot Pie with the side of her foot to shut him up. She didn’t know why she did it, but part of her really didn’t want to know about Gendry’s new fling. 

It wasn’t shocking- she had always known Gendry was attractive. He had no game whatsoever, but his awkward charm only seemed to make girls flaunt to him more, not that he ever really noticed. The past few bar trips the three friends made, Gendry was especially oblivious to a lot of very pretty girl’s more blatant attempts at flirting - one girl even going as far as to throwing her drink on his shirt for ignoring her. Luckily, Arya’s apartment was close by and he always had a stash of extra clothes there just in case. 

Gendry having what could be a more serious relationship in the works would explain his behavior, and admitting that made Arya feel very hollow. 

“So what are we watching?” Changing the topic, Arya plopped herself onto the couch and motioned for Gendry to give her a slice of pizza. 

***

The next few days, Arya tried to catalog when Gendry was on his phone, which wasn’t very often. Once, when he left to go to the bathroom during one of their Sunday coffee trips , she stole her friend’s phone. She picked it up, but when she had gotten to the lockscreen, she had hesitated - it wouldn’t be hard to guess the password (”BULL”), but she still her brain stopped her from opening the phone. 

If she opened it, she would be invading Gendry’s privacy. Which should have bothered her more, but honestly she was never one for “respecting boundaries” when it came to Gendry, nor was he one to ever be bothered by her nosey-personality. No, what stopped her was the same thing that stopped her the few days before when she kicked Hot Pie. If she opened it, and it were true, what then? 

She must have waited to long because before Arya realized it, Gendry was back  from the bathroom.

“What are you doing with my phone?” he asked her defensively, but still made no motion to take it from her. 

Snapping herself back to reality, Arya quickly recovered. “Why do you have the most generic fucking background?” Which was true- it seemed phone-addict Gendry had never figured out how to change the background.

His blush only proved her suspicions. “W-well, I, uh..Shutup!”

She only laughed and pulled him into the booth next to her- ignoring the lack of space between them. Opening the camera, she held the phone up to get both of them in the shot. 

“What are you doing?” he asked her.

“Chaning your background, shh.” She stuck her tongue out and held up an easy peace sign.  Looking at the phone screen, Gendry only laughed at his friend and pulled her closer, his arm wrapping around her shoulders. 

After she showed him how to open his setting and change his background, his arm still loosely laying across her shoulder, Gendry took the phone and tossed it onto his bag that was still lounging in the booth across the table. 

“Now that that’s done, no more phone,” said Gendry as he looked down at his friend. “You were telling me about fencing practice?”

She smiled as she began retelling the story of how she played Joffery out flat in their practice, enjoying the moment and pushing the idea of girlfriends and texts far from her mind.

***

Arya wanted her sister to feel good, but Arya did not understand why they were torturing her to do it. 

“Arya, sit up nicely,” scolded her mother as Arya slouched in the fancily uncomfortable chairs the up-scale dress shoppe had to offer. In celebration of Sansa’s graduation from Law school, Cat Stark offered to buy both her daughters new dresses to wear at the dinner party they were to have after the ceremony. At first it was sweet, but it had been three hours and Arya was ready to go. 

“How about this one?” asked Sansa as she came out in a light pink dress that fell just past her knees. She looked beautiful in it. Just like the other fifteen dresses the girl had tried on. 

“Oh Sans!” their mother cooed again. 

Arya watched as the two gossiped and obsessed over the dress, scrolling through her Instagram as she did. She snorted at a post that had scrolled through - someone Indian advertisement for Google - and sent it to Gendry. He responded with a “hahaha”, which made Arya roll her eyes at how mentally old her friend was sometimes. The she started wondering what he texted his girlfriend - Died he respond the same or did they have long deep conversations? 

“Who are you texting?” Her mother asked her as Sansa went back to change into the next dress. 

“Gendry,” Arya answered. Her mother made a face, hinting at something. Arya rolled her eyes. “Mom, we’re just friends!”

“I know, I know,” Cat calmed her daughter, obviously not believing her. “Hey, why don’t you invite him to Sansa’s graduation dinner?”

“Why?”

“Arya, he’s more than just your friend. Everyone adores him, and he should know that he is welcome to come!”

“If he comes, though, tell him to leave his phone at home!” yelled Sansa from behind the curtain separating her from the dressing room lobby. 

“What are you talking about?” Arya felt a similar sinking feeling in her chest.

“Him, Jon, and I went out the other night and he spent the whole time glued to his phone!” Sansa laughed as she came out in a navy blue dress that fit her figure very nicely. 

“Well the was rude of him,” Mrs. Stark spoke up.

“Oh no, Mother, it was actually very sweet,” Sansa gushed. “He would be in the middle of a sentence and would just stop to giggle at his phone!”

“Gendry doesn’t giggle,” said Arya. 

“Well the closest thing to what Gendry giggling would be,” countered Sansa. “Who is he texting?”

“How should I know?”

“I mean you are only his best friend.”

“Well I guess we’re not as close as you thought then.” Arya grumbled.

Sansa and her mother exchanged looks before turning back to the annoyed Arya.

“Nonetheless, Rickon misses the boy dearly,” said Mrs. Stark. “Please ask him to come.”

***

After Sansa finally agreed on a dress that “Felt like her”- whatever that meant - the three went to lunch at a pub nearby. Arya had been practically shaking with excitement at the idea that she would have a burger and fries in hand within the hour. Despite the fact Arya was twenty-two, Mrs Stark sent Arya to wash her hands before they ate.

“What, why doesn’t Sansa have to?”

“Because Sansa didn’t play with the stray cat outside,” her mother responded, unresolving. “Go wash your hands.”

Grumbling the entire way, Arya made her way to the bathroom. To get there, she had to pass the bar-area of the pub where a large party of people were congregated. Recognizing the grubby and darkened hands, as well as the uniform Stag logo across their mustard-colored shirts, Arya realized that they were all construction workers for Gendry’s father’s company. Which meant…

Eyeing the crowd, her eyes settled on him. Gendry had insisted his father let him work amongst the blue-colored gentlemen and ladies he had admired for so long before he inherited the entire business. And there he was, nestled around the large burly men and women, all laughing after a long-morning of hard work. His hair was damp from sweat, and he was drinking a beer he had probably been nursing longer than any of his coworkers. 

In the briefest of moments, one that only someone truly staring at him as Arya was would notice, Gendry subtly reached into his back pocket and pulled out his phone. His eyebrows knitted together as he sent it onto the table and continued listening to his friends, but with significantly less attention than he had before. 

Arya then pulled her phone and sent a quick text - a picture of the cat she had been playing with earlier. 

Instantly, Gendry’s phone screen light up and the man raced to grab it. Arya watched as her friend’s face softened and he chuckled to himself. He began to type a bit of text, and then Arya saw the “cute” of his response pop-up on her phone. 

The bearded ginger man next to Gendry looked at his phone and began poking his side with his elbow. A group of workers around them joined in at the chirping - saying things like “Who’s the lucky sucker, Gen?” “Hey Bossman, who’s got you smiling like that?” “Look at Cupid!”

Gendry eventually had to leave the crowd hassling him, but had been smiling as he did so. Arya followed him to the hallway leading to the bathroom, his eyes glued to his phone the entire time. 

“Gendry,” Area said to her friend’s back.

Jumping, Gendry turned around. “Jesus, Arry,” he grabbed at his chest. “What the fuck?”

“Who are you texting?” Arya wasted no time in asking, her entire self being coasting on adrenaline at this point. 

“Wha- no one!” Gendry’s breathing and deep-set blush gave him away, so Arya pushed farther.

“Hot Pie and Sansa have both told me that the past few weeks you’ve been addicted to your phone,” Arya explained. “They think you have some secret girlfriend.”

“Girlfriend?” Gendry, if possible, became even more red.

“I didn’t believe them at first, but you certainly very attached to your phone right now.” Arya stepped closer and took said phone out of Gendry’s limp hand. She looked at the picture the two had taken weeks ago. Studying it now, it was very apparent how comfortable Gendry looked- more comfortable than he did with any of the other girls he had talked to at the bar, and more like how he looked when he had received her texted earlier. “Is it me?”

Gendry stayed silent, eyes glued to the phone screen Arya had been studying. 

“Because I like you.” She said it casually, but her heart was racing faster than it ever had before. 

“You what?” Gendry looked dup to meet her eyes.

She only quirked her eyebrow as he studied her face. His eyes followed the movement, slowly circling her features until they landed on her lips.

“Arya-” he had said, breathlessly. 

The word was all the encouragement Arya needed. The love drenched in every syllable of her name was too much for her to handle. She surged up meet his mouth with hers and kissed him deeply. His hands cradled her back, immediately responding to her. 

The broke off as quickly as they had begun, both very aware that they were still in a very public area. 

“My mother wants you to come to Sansa’s graduation dinner,” she told him in between breaths. 

“Do you want me to come?” He asked sincerely, but part of him already knowing the answer. 

“Yes.”

“As your friend or…” His eyes looked hopefully as he asked it. Arya laughed at herself for ever thinking there was ever anyone else. This was Gendry, the boy that would listen to her rants for days on end, who would do anything for her. What other girl could compete?

“Boyfriend.” She said, trying and failing to hold back a smile.

“My mother wants you to come to Sansa’s graduation dinner,” she told him in between breaths. 

“Do you want me to come?” He asked sincerely, but part of him already knowing the answer. 

“Yes.”

“As your friend or…” His eyes looked hopefully as he asked it. Arya laughed at herself for ever thinking there was ever anyone else. This was Gendry, the boy that would listen to her rants for days on end, who would do anything for her. What other girl could compete?

“Boyfriend.” She said, trying and failing to hold back a smile.

trail.content_raw:
Canon is being perfect, so Imma write some AU fics to get me through the week. 

Gendrya Modern!Au Whoop whoop!

“Do you think we should ask Gendry to invite his girlfriend?” asked Hot Pie as sorted through his extensive bad-movie collection. 

Arya felt her heart stop for a moment, but ignored it. “What are you talking about?” 

“That girl he’s always texting,” responded Hot Pie casually. Finally, he looked up and noticed his friend’s unreadable expression. “Don’t tell me you haven’t noticed? The dude is addicted to his phone!”

[[MORE]]

“Gendry?” questioned Arya. Gendry wasn’t addicted to his phone. Arya spent months  trying to convince him to trade in his Nokia for a smartphone, and even then it was only after his new job required him to. She spent three hours last week teaching him how to download Snapchat before the guy completely gave up and nearly destroyed it. 

Hot Pie laughed. “Arry, you seriously haven’t noticed?”

“How do you know he’s texting a girl though?”

“He always gets smiley and shit, plus yesterday I asked him about it and his face got sooo red!” Hot Pie went back to shuffle through a few discs. “Do you think she could set me up with one of her friends when he finally introduces us?”

“Introduces who?” Gendry walked into his and Hot Pie’s shared apartment with an extra-large pizza in his arms. 

“Your girlf-” Arya kicked Hot Pie with the side of her foot to shut him up. She didn’t know why she did it, but part of her really didn’t want to know about Gendry’s new fling. 

It wasn’t shocking- she had always known Gendry was attractive. He had no game whatsoever, but his awkward charm only seemed to make girls flaunt to him more, not that he ever really noticed. The past few bar trips the three friends made, Gendry was especially oblivious to a lot of very pretty girl’s more blatant attempts at flirting - one girl even going as far as to throwing her drink on his shirt for ignoring her. Luckily, Arya’s apartment was close by and he always had a stash of extra clothes there just in case. 

Gendry having what could be a more serious relationship in the works would explain his behavior, and admitting that made Arya feel very hollow. 

“So what are we watching?” Changing the topic, Arya plopped herself onto the couch and motioned for Gendry to give her a slice of pizza. 

***

The next few days, Arya tried to catalog when Gendry was on his phone, which wasn’t very often. Once, when he left to go to the bathroom during one of their Sunday coffee trips , she stole her friend’s phone. She picked it up, but when she had gotten to the lockscreen, she had hesitated - it wouldn’t be hard to guess the password (”BULL”), but she still her brain stopped her from opening the phone. 

If she opened it, she would be invading Gendry’s privacy. Which should have bothered her more, but honestly she was never one for “respecting boundaries” when it came to Gendry, nor was he one to ever be bothered by her nosey-personality. No, what stopped her was the same thing that stopped her the few days before when she kicked Hot Pie. If she opened it, and it were true, what then? 

She must have waited to long because before Arya realized it, Gendry was back  from the bathroom.

“What are you doing with my phone?” he asked her defensively, but still made no motion to take it from her. 

Snapping herself back to reality, Arya quickly recovered. “Why do you have the most generic fucking background?” Which was true- it seemed phone-addict Gendry had never figured out how to change the background.

His blush only proved her suspicions. “W-well, I, uh..Shutup!”

She only laughed and pulled him into the booth next to her- ignoring the lack of space between them. Opening the camera, she held the phone up to get both of them in the shot. 

“What are you doing?” he asked her.

“Chaning your background, shh.” She stuck her tongue out and held up an easy peace sign.  Looking at the phone screen, Gendry only laughed at his friend and pulled her closer, his arm wrapping around her shoulders. 

After she showed him how to open his setting and change his background, his arm still loosely laying across her shoulder, Gendry took the phone and tossed it onto his bag that was still lounging in the booth across the table. 

“Now that that’s done, no more phone,” said Gendry as he looked down at his friend. “You were telling me about fencing practice?”

She smiled as she began retelling the story of how she played Joffery out flat in their practice, enjoying the moment and pushing the idea of girlfriends and texts far from her mind.

***

Arya wanted her sister to feel good, but Arya did not understand why they were torturing her to do it. 

“Arya, sit up nicely,” scolded her mother as Arya slouched in the fancily uncomfortable chairs the up-scale dress shoppe had to offer. In celebration of Sansa’s graduation from Law school, Cat Stark offered to buy both her daughters new dresses to wear at the dinner party they were to have after the ceremony. At first it was sweet, but it had been three hours and Arya was ready to go. 

“How about this one?” asked Sansa as she came out in a light pink dress that fell just past her knees. She looked beautiful in it. Just like the other fifteen dresses the girl had tried on. 

“Oh Sans!” their mother cooed again. 

Arya watched as the two gossiped and obsessed over the dress, scrolling through her Instagram as she did. She snorted at a post that had scrolled through - someone Indian advertisement for Google - and sent it to Gendry. He responded with a “hahaha”, which made Arya roll her eyes at how mentally old her friend was sometimes. The she started wondering what he texted his girlfriend - Died he respond the same or did they have long deep conversations? 

“Who are you texting?” Her mother asked her as Sansa went back to change into the next dress. 

“Gendry,” Arya answered. Her mother made a face, hinting at something. Arya rolled her eyes. “Mom, we’re just friends!”

“I know, I know,” Cat calmed her daughter, obviously not believing her. “Hey, why don’t you invite him to Sansa’s graduation dinner?”

“Why?”

“Arya, he’s more than just your friend. Everyone adores him, and he should know that he is welcome to come!”

“If he comes, though, tell him to leave his phone at home!” yelled Sansa from behind the curtain separating her from the dressing room lobby. 

“What are you talking about?” Arya felt a similar sinking feeling in her chest.

“Him, Jon, and I went out the other night and he spent the whole time glued to his phone!” Sansa laughed as she came out in a navy blue dress that fit her figure very nicely. 

“Well the was rude of him,” Mrs. Stark spoke up.

“Oh no, Mother, it was actually very sweet,” Sansa gushed. “He would be in the middle of a sentence and would just stop to giggle at his phone!”

“Gendry doesn’t giggle,” said Arya. 

“Well the closest thing to what Gendry giggling would be,” countered Sansa. “Who is he texting?”

“How should I know?”

“I mean you are only his best friend.”

“Well I guess we’re not as close as you thought then.” Arya grumbled.

Sansa and her mother exchanged looks before turning back to the annoyed Arya.

“Nonetheless, Rickon misses the boy dearly,” said Mrs. Stark. “Please ask him to come.”

***

After Sansa finally agreed on a dress that “Felt like her”- whatever that meant - the three went to lunch at a pub nearby. Arya had been practically shaking with excitement at the idea that she would have a burger and fries in hand within the hour. Despite the fact Arya was twenty-two, Mrs Stark sent Arya to wash her hands before they ate.

“What, why doesn’t Sansa have to?”

“Because Sansa didn’t play with the stray cat outside,” her mother responded, unresolving. “Go wash your hands.”

Grumbling the entire way, Arya made her way to the bathroom. To get there, she had to pass the bar-area of the pub where a large party of people were congregated. Recognizing the grubby and darkened hands, as well as the uniform Stag logo across their mustard-colored shirts, Arya realized that they were all construction workers for Gendry’s father’s company. Which meant…

Eyeing the crowd, her eyes settled on him. Gendry had insisted his father let him work amongst the blue-colored gentlemen and ladies he had admired for so long before he inherited the entire business. And there he was, nestled around the large burly men and women, all laughing after a long-morning of hard work. His hair was damp from sweat, and he was drinking a beer he had probably been nursing longer than any of his coworkers. 

In the briefest of moments, one that only someone truly staring at him as Arya was would notice, Gendry subtly reached into his back pocket and pulled out his phone. His eyebrows knitted together as he sent it onto the table and continued listening to his friends, but with significantly less attention than he had before. 

Arya then pulled her phone and sent a quick text - a picture of the cat she had been playing with earlier. 

Instantly, Gendry’s phone screen light up and the man raced to grab it. Arya watched as her friend’s face softened and he chuckled to himself. He began to type a bit of text, and then Arya saw the “cute” of his response pop-up on her phone. 

The bearded ginger man next to Gendry looked at his phone and began poking his side with his elbow. A group of workers around them joined in at the chirping - saying things like “Who’s the lucky sucker, Gen?” “Hey Bossman, who’s got you smiling like that?” “Look at Cupid!”

Gendry eventually had to leave the crowd hassling him, but had been smiling as he did so. Arya followed him to the hallway leading to the bathroom, his eyes glued to his phone the entire time. 

“Gendry,” Area said to her friend’s back.

Jumping, Gendry turned around. “Jesus, Arry,” he grabbed at his chest. “What the fuck?”

“Who are you texting?” Arya wasted no time in asking, her entire self being coasting on adrenaline at this point. 

“Wha- no one!” Gendry’s breathing and deep-set blush gave him away, so Arya pushed farther.

“Hot Pie and Sansa have both told me that the past few weeks you’ve been addicted to your phone,” Arya explained. “They think you have some secret girlfriend.”

“Girlfriend?” Gendry, if possible, became even more red.

“I didn’t believe them at first, but you certainly very attached to your phone right now.” Arya stepped closer and took said phone out of Gendry’s limp hand. She looked at the picture the two had taken weeks ago. Studying it now, it was very apparent how comfortable Gendry looked- more comfortable than he did with any of the other girls he had talked to at the bar, and more like how he looked when he had received her texted earlier. “Is it me?”

Gendry stayed silent, eyes glued to the phone screen Arya had been studying. 

“Because I like you.” She said it casually, but her heart was racing faster than it ever had before. 

“You what?” Gendry looked dup to meet her eyes.

She only quirked her eyebrow as he studied her face. His eyes followed the movement, slowly circling her features until they landed on her lips.

“Arya-” he had said, breathlessly. 

The word was all the encouragement Arya needed. The love drenched in every syllable of her name was too much for her to handle. She surged up meet his mouth with hers and kissed him deeply. His hands cradled her back, immediately responding to her. 

The broke off as quickly as they had begun, both very aware that they were still in a very public area. 

“My mother wants you to come to Sansa’s graduation dinner,” she told him in between breaths. 

“Do you want me to come?” He asked sincerely, but part of him already knowing the answer. 

“Yes.”

“As your friend or…” His eyes looked hopefully as he asked it. Arya laughed at herself for ever thinking there was ever anyone else. This was Gendry, the boy that would listen to her rants for days on end, who would do anything for her. What other girl could compete?

“Boyfriend.” She said, trying and failing to hold back a smile.

body: sometimes I feel like some people just feel the need to ship sansa with someone because she’s lady-like, she once had dreamed of her prince charming and she’s just a feminine character who doesn’t actively fight like brienne or arya might do. so she has to seek for romance once again, or she won’t possibly be happy by her own… and I feel those people are the other side of the coin to who thinks that arya shouldn’t be involved in anything romantic, not have sexual desires or feelings that go past her loyalty to her family and her desire for revenge. just because they can’t accept that a strong female fighter, who isn’t overly sexualized, can feel lust and love.

title: arya and gendry
body:
She was angry. One of the many things she was feeling at the moment such as pain, fear, sadness, defeat but angry was at the top of her list. She was angry at him. Yes it was completely irrational but she was angry at him. Angry she couldn’t find him. Angry that he is possibly dead. Angry that he couldn’t stay safe and not get injured , dead or turned into the undead. She had gotten to the boats in the retreat from Winterfell as she, sansa, jon and bran watched their home burn to the ground taking all the wights with it. The battle had been lost with huge casualties and now they were retreating to Dragonstone.

Once they disembarked from the ships healing stations were set up for the injured and the castle was where everyone went to mourn those lost and to try to regroup even though at the moment they seemed impossible. Arya noted that Jamie, tyrion, brienne, and davos survived but theon, jorah, greyworm and podrick had perished. So many deaths and now they were left with the remains of the lannister army and the unsullied and dothraki. Small numbers. They had lost the battle or in no small words they got their asses kicked. But still Arya was angry because of one person she couldn’t find and now assumed he was dead. Bastard you fucking bastard Gendry why couldn’t you stay alive! With tears in her eyes she slowly moved up toward the castle to claim a room and mourn the loss of those who died especially mourn the loss of the man she loved.

As she was walking she noticed the hound, of course that fucker would survive the battle, the hound were survive but Gendry didnt. This pissed off Arya more as she walked past him trying not to glare at him as she did. As she passed him the hound he called out to her. “Ah if its not the little assassin girl. I knew you would survive the battle you are too annoying to die. Just like the bloody blacksmith.” Arya turned sharply to him as soon as he mentioned blacksmith and there was only one blacksmith he would be talking about, Gendry. “If you are looking for the annoying bastard he isn’t down here. He went up to the castle courtyard to help set up a new forge. He spent the whole ride here being a pain in my ass and the moment he got off the damn ship he started asking about you. Apparently he didnt seem to care about his injuries. He only wanted to know if you were alive.” As he turned toward Arya he noticed he was talking to no one as she had already taken off to find gendry. The hound shook his head as he figured out why whenever she showed up at the forge at winterfell that work there came to a skidding halt.

Gendry had limped his way up to the castle courtyard with several other men and located a decent area to rebuild a forge but at the current moment building a new forge was the last thing on their minds. Gendry had disembarked the ship with the hound who he thinks was ready to cleave him in half with the axe he made him but he was done with the hound being an ass to him and being snarky back to him was the only thing he had going for him. Since he was sure if he tried to hit him with his hammer his hammer would break. So snarky and being a pain in his ass was his fall back. As soon as he got off the ship he asked about the starks and the dragon lady to see who survived the fight. He ran into jon snow, sansa and dany as he made his way up to the castle but Arya wasn’t with him and no one seemed to know the answer to his question when he asked about arya. There was no way in hell he was going to ask lady sansa or jon snow about arya since that would lead to questions and he would rather get stabbed by a wight again thank you very much. So Gendry limped his way up to the courtyard praying he would see arya on his way there. He had found a spot in the courtyard near a crumbling wall that had some grain sacks and he threw a blanket down and collapsed as his injuries and fatigue of battle finally hit him.

Arya got to the courtyard as fast as her legs could carry her and injured the pain racing through her leg injury and how her head wound was making her feel dizzy and nauseous but she didnt care he was up here somewhere and she was determined to find him. He was alive and that was all that matter to her at the moment. As she entered the castle courtyard jon and sansa both got to her. “Arya you need to rest! You look like you are about to collapse. Healer! I need a healer over here now.” Sansa ordered as she gripped Arya’s arm and jon ducked down to pick her up and carry her to a cot nearby. “I’m fine put me down! I need to find him. I know he is up here some where please put me down and let me find him!” Arya half begged half pleaded as jon lowered her to a cot and a healer came in to attend to her injuries. “Who are you looking for Arya? Find him? whose him?” Sansa questioned as Arya tried to stand while brushing off the hands of the healer. “Gendry. I’m looking for Gendry the hound told me he was up here. Sansa please let me find him.” Sansa and jon were shook. Gendry was the blacksmith and jon knew Gendry was Robert Baratheons bastard son. What did this man mean to Arya? or should he be asking why did he mean so much to Arya that she had to find him? Jon didn’t want to think to much on it and pressed Arya back down to the cot. “Arya if he is up here I will find him. You stay here with the healers and Sansa I will go find the blacksm….. Gendry I will locate him and bring him too you.” Jon stood as he glanced at Sansa indicating to her to keep Arya here as he turned and started to search the courtyard for one man amongst a few hundred.

Jon moved swiftly as he looked around the courtyard checking on the injured as he passed and ordering healers to those who needed help urgently. He passed by jamie and brienne and nodded to them as they tended to their injuries while the devastating battle took its toll on them. Jon rounded a corner as he looked at more injured and recognized a few men that worked at the forge at winterfell and silently prayed Gendry was amongst them. He wasn’t with them and for a brief moment he feared the hound had lied to Arya about Gendry surviving the fight and if the hound did mistakenly give Arya false hope the hound was about to meet he pointy end of his sword. As he was making that promise he came across a small alcove near the other forge workers and to his utter relief he saw Gendry on sacks of grain passed out and still bleeding from wounds. “I need healers here now! This man needs aid now! You give me a hand we need to get this man over to the healers immediately.” Jon ordered a soldier near him to help carry Gendry to the healers and Arya.

Sansa heard Jon yell for healers and spun around to see Jon and another man carrying who she assumed was Gendry toward the healers station. She felt Arya move and attempt to get up to try to get to Gendry. “Gendry! Please wake up please be ok. Don’t die on me. I just got you back I don’t want to lose you again.” Sansa heard arya saying to him as he was placed on a cot next to her as healers raced to him to look at his wounds that looked terrible. Arya gripped his hand bending her head to his and whispered things to him that Sansa and jon could not hear. Jon and Sansa observed the healers taking care of both of them and Arya refused to let go of Gendry’s hand and didn’t care she was in the way she wasn’t going to leave his side. To Jon’s amazement he noticed Gendry open his eyes as he locked eyes with Arya and Jon heard one word that was barely a whisper but was accompanied by a smile from the blacksmith “Arya.” Arya smiled with tears running down her face as she placed a kiss on his forehead as his grip on her hand tightened.

Hours later as everyone was sleeping or had fallen unconscious due to pain, exhaustion, fatigue and adrenaline wearing off Jon snow wondered the court yard and paused at the healers station where Arya and Gendry were located and he was amazed at what he saw. Arya’s cot was empty as she at some point had crawled onto the one Gendry was on and was curled up next to him or well Gendry was curled around her. Arya’s back was pressed into the chest of Gendry and Gendry’s arms were wrapped around her crushing her to his chest. His one arm was dropped across her waist and the other was wrapped around her shoulders and his face was tucked into the back of her head as her hair half covered his face. Arya’s one hand was gripping his arm wrapped around her waist and her other hand was intertwined with his around her shoulders. Jon could not see their legs underneath the blanket covering them. Arya looked at peace as she slept in the arms of Robert Baratheons bastard son and to Jon’s knowledge he believed that Gendry was the last remaining Baratheon in the seven kingdoms. That was something a lot of people would take interest in. But to Arya he was something else he was important to her and that far more important to Jon because if people found out who Gendry really was his life was in far more danger then he could imagine. Here he was protected from that at the moment and he was needed in the fight against the night king. He was a fighter and he was a blacksmith who could help make weapons to destroy the white walkers. But first they needed to regroup from the battle. High above him the dragons perched on the walls overlooking the castle and its battle wary inhabitants.

I know he is up here some where please put me down and let me find him!” Arya half begged half pleaded as jon lowered her to a cot and a healer came in to attend to her injuries. “Who are you looking for Arya? Find him? whose him?” Sansa questioned as Arya tried to stand while brushing off the hands of the healer. “Gendry. I’m looking for Gendry the hound told me he was up here. Sansa please let me find him.” Sansa and jon were shook. Gendry was the blacksmith and jon knew Gendry was Robert Baratheons bastard son. What did this man mean to Arya? or should he be asking why did he mean so much to Arya that she had to find him? Jon didn’t want to think to much on it and pressed Arya back down to the cot. “Arya if he is up here I will find him. You stay here with the healers and Sansa I will go find the blacksm….. Gendry I will locate him and bring him too you.” Jon stood as he glanced at Sansa indicating to her to keep Arya here as he turned and started to search the courtyard for one man amongst a few hundred.

Jon moved swiftly as he looked around the courtyard checking on the injured as he passed and ordering healers to those who needed help urgently. He passed by jamie and brienne and nodded to them as they tended to their injuries while the devastating battle took its toll on them. Jon rounded a corner as he looked at more injured and recognized a few men that worked at the forge at winterfell and silently prayed Gendry was amongst them. He wasn’t with them and for a brief moment he feared the hound had lied to Arya about Gendry surviving the fight and if the hound did mistakenly give Arya false hope the hound was about to meet he pointy end of his sword. As he was making that promise he came across a small alcove near the other forge workers and to his utter relief he saw Gendry on sacks of grain passed out and still bleeding from wounds. “I need healers here now! This man needs aid now! You give me a hand we need to get this man over to the healers immediately.” Jon ordered a soldier near him to help carry Gendry to the healers and Arya.

Sansa heard Jon yell for healers and spun around to see Jon and another man carrying who she assumed was Gendry toward the healers station. She felt Arya move and attempt to get up to try to get to Gendry. “Gendry! Please wake up please be ok. Don’t die on me. I just got you back I don’t want to lose you again.” Sansa heard arya saying to him as he was placed on a cot next to her as healers raced to him to look at his wounds that looked terrible. Arya gripped his hand bending her head to his and whispered things to him that Sansa and jon could not hear. Jon and Sansa observed the healers taking care of both of them and Arya refused to let go of Gendry’s hand and didn’t care she was in the way she wasn’t going to leave his side. To Jon’s amazement he noticed Gendry open his eyes as he locked eyes with Arya and Jon heard one word that was barely a whisper but was accompanied by a smile from the blacksmith “Arya.” Arya smiled with tears running down her face as she placed a kiss on his forehead as his grip on her hand tightened.

Hours later as everyone was sleeping or had fallen unconscious due to pain, exhaustion, fatigue and adrenaline wearing off Jon snow wondered the court yard and paused at the healers station where Arya and Gendry were located and he was amazed at what he saw. Arya’s cot was empty as she at some point had crawled onto the one Gendry was on and was curled up next to him or well Gendry was curled around her. Arya’s back was pressed into the chest of Gendry and Gendry’s arms were wrapped around her crushing her to his chest. His one arm was dropped across her waist and the other was wrapped around her shoulders and his face was tucked into the back of her head as her hair half covered his face. Arya’s one hand was gripping his arm wrapped around her waist and her other hand was intertwined with his around her shoulders. Jon could not see their legs underneath the blanket covering them. Arya looked at peace as she slept in the arms of Robert Baratheons bastard son and to Jon’s knowledge he believed that Gendry was the last remaining Baratheon in the seven kingdoms. That was something a lot of people would take interest in. But to Arya he was something else he was important to her and that far more important to Jon because if people found out who Gendry really was his life was in far more danger then he could imagine. Here he was protected from that at the moment and he was needed in the fight against the night king. He was a fighter and he was a blacksmith who could help make weapons to destroy the white walkers. But first they needed to regroup from the battle. High above him the dragons perched on the walls overlooking the castle and its battle wary inhabitants.
